feed.title: Google Cloud: App Engine standard environment Ruby
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: App Engine standard environment Ruby

entry.content: Support for deploying your existing apps in the standard environment to Cloud Run using the gcloud beta app migrate-to-run command is in Preview. For more information, see Deploy an App Engine app in the standard environment to Cloud Run.
entry.summary: You can now migrate your existing App Engine standard environment apps to Cloud Run using the `gcloud beta app migrate-to-run` command. This feature is currently in Preview and allows for a smoother transition to a more flexible platform. For detailed instructions, refer to the migration documentation.
entry.title: Feature: Migrate App Engine to Cloud Run

entry.content: To increase security, starting in March 2025, support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1.1 and earlier is deprecated. Update your application settings in the App Engine standard environment to use TLS version 1.2 and later, along with a corresponding secure set of cipher suites (Preview).
entry.title: Feature: TLS 1.1 and earlier deprecated in March 2025

entry.content: Support for the Ruby 3.4 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now in General Availability.
entry.title: Feature: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available
